Pre-Game Insights: Ghana has been dealt major blows in terms of the availability of key players, with Thomas Partey, Joseph Paintsil, Kingsley Schindler, and Osman Ibrahim all ruled out.
Sudan, on the other hand, has no injury worries and came to Ghana with the full complement of their squad.
Group F standings: After one point from two games, the Black Stars currently lie third on the table, while Sudan has three points from two games and is second.
Otto Addo’s record as Ghana coach: The Black Stars have played six matches since Otto Addo returned as substantive coach. The Black Stars have won two, lost two, and drawn two of the matches.
Kwasi Appiah’s record as Sudan coach: Under Kwasi Appiah, Sudan has played sixteen matches, winning eight, drawing four, and losing four of the sixteen matches.
Ghana vs Sudan head-to-head: Ghana and Sudan have met 14 times, with the Black Stars having the upper hand in terms of the number of victories chalked so far.
